subject: Languages
title: Japanese and Korean: Related or Not?
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Japanese and Korean: Related or Not?.

hook.text: Japanese and Korean have strikingly similar grammar. Whether they're actually related is linguistics' biggest maybe.

buildup.text: Both are SOV (subject-object-verb) languages with agglutinating morphology and honorific systems.

discovery.text: Some linguists group them in the 'Altaic' family with Turkish and Mongolian. Others say that's wrong.

twist.text: The similar grammar might be from contact rather than shared ancestry â€” neighbors borrow structures too.

climax.text: As of today, mainstream linguistics considers both Japanese and Korean to be language isolates.

punchline.text: Two languages that look like twins might just be neighbors who dressed alike.

quiz.question: What is the current mainstream view on Japanese and Korean's relationship?
options: They are both considered language isolates â€” no proven relationship
